definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to combine together for self-improvement/joint movement for self-strengthening
Self-Strengthening Movement (period of reforms in China c 1861-1894), also named 洋務運動|洋务运动

sentences.english: To de fend our country we must strengthen ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 为了保卫祖国，我们必须自强不息。

sentences.english: In the household, young kids are imbued with concept of self-reliance.
sentences.chinese: 在家庭中，孩子从小就被灌输自立自强的观念。

sentences.english: What do I have in mind in this program of self-strengthening?
sentences.chinese: 我对自强的看法是什么呢？

sentences.english: However, Yan Yuan's distinct character was continuous self-renewal to perfect virtues.
sentences.chinese: 然而颜渊之本色，在自强不息以进德。

sentences.english: The Asian people have an unyielding national spirit and great creativity.
sentences.chinese: 亚洲人民有着自强不息的民族精神和杰出的创造力。

sentences.english: Janie brims with independence and strength.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮独立自强，充满活力。

sentences.english: The time the public recalled about their self-strengthening consciousness coming into being was the period of their taking up an occupation.
sentences.chinese: 人们回忆起自强意识产生的时闻主要在参加工作以后。

sentences.english: The running Hanjiang River water has cultivated the Xiantao people's unremitting self-improvement spirit.
sentences.chinese: 奔腾不息的汉江水，孕育了仙桃人自强不息的精神。

sentences.english: Only self confidence, you can pay the bill of life.
sentences.chinese: 只有自强自立自信，你才能付得起人生的账单。

sentences.english: King Rehoboam established himself firmly in Jerusalem and continued as king.
sentences.chinese: 罗波安王自强，在耶路撒冷作王。
天行健，君子当自强不息。

sentences.english: However, the nature of self-reliance so that he leaves in the spring, the lush up quickly.
sentences.chinese: 但是自强的本性让他的叶子在春日里，迅速繁茂起来。

sentences.english: The Chinese civilization has always given prominence to unremitting self-improvement, reform and innovation.
sentences.chinese: 中华文明历来注重自强不息，不断革故鼎新。

sentences.english: The great peoples of Asia have had a fine tradition of self-strengthening in times of adversity.
sentences.chinese: 伟大的亚洲人民有着逆境自强的优良传统。

sentences.english: So King Rehoboam grew strong in Jerusalem and reigned.
sentences.chinese: 罗波安王自强，在耶路撒冷作王。

sentences.english: At the same time in the national crisis, he strongly called for self-salvation.
sentences.chinese: 同时在国难当头的时候，他极力呼吁自强救国。

definition: to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
to have a sense of shame
self-respect/self-love/self-regard/regard for oneself/to cherish one's good name/to take good care of one's health
Never forget national humiliation, refers to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
independent/self-reliant/self-sustaining/to stand on one's own feet/to support oneself
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to make an effort/to push for sth/to work hard
to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
